content: पाशः [पश्यते बध्यतेऽनेन, पश्-करणे घञ्] {@--1@} A cord, chain, fetter, noose; पादाकृष्टव्रततिवलयासंगसंजातपाशः <ls>Ś. 1. 33</ls>; बाहुपाशेन व्यापादिता <ls>Mk. 9</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 84.</ls> {@--2@} A snare, trap or net for catching birds and beasts. {@--3@} A noose used as a weapon (as by Varuṇa); <ls>Ku. 2. 21.</ls> {@--4@} A die, dice; <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>R. 6. 18.</ls> {@--5@} The edge or border of anything woven. {@--6@} (At the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) पाश expresses ({%a%}) contempt or depreciation; as in छत्रपाशः a bad pupil; वैयाकरण°, भिषक्° &c. ({%b%}) beauty or admiration; as in सैवोष्ठमुद्रा स च कर्णपाशः <ls>U. 6. 27.</ls> ({%c%}) abundance, mass, or quantity (after a word signifying ‘hair’); as in केशपाश <ab>q. v.</ab>
